- 1 pack Maggi noodles 
- 1 1/2 cups water 
- 1/4 cup chopped onions 
- 1/4 cup chopped tomatoes 
- 1 green chili, chopped 
- 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder 
- 1/4 teaspoon red chili powder 
- 1 tablespoon oil 
- Fresh coriander for garnish 
- Salt to taste

- Heat oil in a pan, sauté onions and green chili until soft 
- Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften 
- Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt, mix well 
- Pour in 1 1/2 cups of water and bring to a boil 
- Add Maggi noodles and the spice packet that comes with it 
- Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally 
- Let the water reduce until noodles are cooked through 
- Garnish with fresh coriander 
- Serve hot and enjoy your flavorful Maggi 
- Perfect as a quick meal or snack

- 2 cups sushi rice 
- 3 tablespoons rice vinegar 
- 1 tablespoon sugar 
- 1/2 teaspoon salt 
- 4 sheets nori (seaweed) 
- 1 cucumber, julienned 
- 1 avocado, sliced 
- 200g fresh tuna or salmon, sliced 
- Soy sauce for dipping 
- Wasabi and pickled ginger for serving

- Cook sushi rice according to package instructions 
- Mix rice vinegar, sugar, and salt, then stir into cooked rice 
- Place a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat 
- Spread a thin layer of rice on the nori, leaving space at the top edge 
- Place cucumber, avocado, and fish in the center of the rice 
- Roll the sushi tightly using the mat, pressing gently 
- Slice the roll into bite-sized pieces with a sharp knife 
- Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger 
- Enjoy your fresh homemade makizushi

- 300g mackerel, boiled and flaked 
- 4 cups tamarind juice 
- 1 stalk lemongrass, bruised 
- 2 tablespoons chili paste 
- 1 onion, sliced 
- 1 cucumber, julienned 
- 1 pineapple, diced 
- 200g rice noodles 
- Fresh mint leaves for garnish 
- Fish sauce to taste

- In a pot, bring tamarind juice, lemongrass, and chili paste to a boil 
- Add flaked mackerel and simmer for 10 minutes 
- Cook rice noodles according to package instructions 
- Divide noodles into bowls and pour the soup over them 
- Top with cucumber, pineapple, onion, and mint leaves 
- Add fish sauce to taste 
- Serve hot with additional chili paste if desired 
- Enjoy the tangy, spicy flavors of Penang Asam Laksa

- 1.5kg beef roast 
- 2 cups red wine vinegar 
- 1 cup water 
- 1 onion, chopped 
- 2 cloves garlic, minced 
- 2 bay leaves 
- 1 teaspoon peppercorns 
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves 
- 2 tablespoons sugar 
- Gingersnap cookies for thickening sauce

- In a large bowl, mix vinegar, water, onion, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns, cloves, and sugar 
- Submerge the beef roast in the marinade and refrigerate for 3-5 days 
- Remove the roast from the marinade and pat dry 
- Brown the roast in a large pot, then add the marinade 
- Cover and simmer for 3-4 hours until the meat is tender 
- Crush gingersnap cookies and stir into the sauce to thicken 
- Slice the roast and serve with the rich sauce 
- Enjoy your hearty and flavorful Sauerbraten

- 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour 
- 1 1/2 cups sugar 
- 1 teaspoon baking soda 
- 1 teaspoon cocoa powder 
- 1 1/2 cups vegetable oil 
- 1 cup buttermilk 
- 2 large eggs 
- 2 tablespoons red food coloring 
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
- Cream cheese frosting for topping

- Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F) and grease two round cake pans 
- In a large bowl, sift together flour, sugar, baking soda, and cocoa powder 
- In another bowl, mix oil, buttermilk, eggs, food coloring, and vanilla 
- Combine the wet and dry ingredients, stir until smooth 
- Pour batter into cake pans and bake for 30-35 minutes 
- Let the cakes cool completely before removing from pans 
- Frost the cake with cream cheese frosting 
- Slice and serve your rich, moist Red Velvet Cake 
- Enjoy this classic, decadent dessert

- 1 cup all-purpose flour 
- 2 large eggs 
- 1 1/2 cups milk 
- 1 tablespoon melted butter 
- 1 tablespoon sugar (optional) 
- Pinch of salt 
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
- Butter for greasing pan 
- Nutella or jam for filling 
- Powdered sugar for garnish

- In a bowl, whisk together flour, eggs, milk, butter, sugar, and vanilla extract 
- Let the batter rest for 15-20 minutes 
- Heat a non-stick pan and grease lightly with butter 
- Pour a thin layer of batter into the pan, swirling to spread evenly 
- Cook for 1-2 minutes on each side until golden brown 
- Fill with Nutella, jam, or your favorite fillings 
- Roll or fold the crêpe and dust with powdered sugar 
- Serve and enjoy this light, delicious treat

- 500g ground turkey 
- 1/4 cup breadcrumbs 
- 1 egg 
- 1 small onion, finely chopped 
- 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard 
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder 
- Salt and pepper to taste 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil 
- Burger buns 
- Toppings: lettuce, tomato, cheese

- In a bowl, mix ground turkey, breadcrumbs, egg, onion, mustard, garlic powder, salt, and pepper 
- Form the mixture into patties 
- Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat 
- Cook the turkey patties for 5-6 minutes on each side until cooked through 
- Toast burger buns in the same skillet 
- Assemble burgers with your favorite toppings like lettuce, tomato, and cheese 
- Serve hot and enjoy your healthy turkey burgers 
- Perfect for a quick lunch or dinner

- 4 large potatoes 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil 
- 1/2 teaspoon sea salt 
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika 
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder 
- Fresh parsley for garnish 
- Ketchup for dipping 
- Oil for frying 
- Salt to taste

- Peel and cut potatoes into crinkle-cut fries using a crinkle cutter 
- Soak the fries in cold water for 30 minutes, then pat dry 
- Heat oil in a deep fryer or pan 
- Fry the fries in batches until golden and crispy 
- Drain on paper towels and season with sea salt, pepper, and paprika 
- Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with ketchup 
- Enjoy your crispy crinkle-cut fries 
- Perfect as a snack or side dish

- 2 cups pre-cooked cornmeal (harina P.A.N.) 
- 2 1/2 cups warm water 
- 1 teaspoon salt 
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 
- Butter for cooking 
- Cheese for filling (optional) 
- Avocado for serving (optional) 
- Shredded chicken for serving (optional) 
- Black beans for serving (optional) 
- Salsa for serving (optional)

- In a large bowl, mix the cornmeal, warm water, and salt 
- Let the dough rest for 5 minutes until it firms up 
- Knead the dough with your hands until smooth 
- Divide the dough into small balls and flatten into thick discs 
- Heat oil or butter in a skillet over medium heat 
- Cook the arepas for about 5 minutes on each side until golden brown 
- Slice the cooked arepas in half to create pockets 
- Fill with cheese, avocado, chicken, or black beans as desired 
- Serve hot with salsa or any other topping of your choice 
- Enjoy freshly made arepas for breakfast or dinner

- 1 kg fresh crab, cleaned and cracked 
- 4 tablespoons butter 
- 6 cloves garlic, minced 
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice 
- 2 tablespoons chopped parsley 
- 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes 
- Salt to taste 
- Black pepper to taste 
- 1/4 cup water or seafood broth 
- Lemon wedges for garnish

- Clean and crack the crabs 
- Melt the butter in a large pan over medium heat 
- Add the minced garlic and sauté until fragrant 
- Stir in the lemon juice, parsley, and chili flakes 
- Add the cracked crabs and stir to coat them in the butter mixture 
- Pour in water or seafood broth, cover, and cook for 5-7 minutes 
- Season with salt and pepper to taste 
- Uncover and cook for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens 
- Serve the crabs hot with lemon wedges for garnish 
- Enjoy the crabs with bread or rice

- 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts 
- 1 cup breadcrumbs 
- 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese 
- 2 large eggs 
- 1 cup marinara sauce 
- 1 1/2 cups mozzarella cheese, shredded 
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder 
- Salt to taste 
- Black pepper to taste 
- Fresh basil leaves for garnish

- Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) 
- Pound chicken breasts to even thickness 
- Season chicken with salt, pepper, and garlic powder 
- Beat eggs in a shallow dish and dip the chicken in eggs 
- Mix breadcrumbs and Parmesan cheese in another dish 
- Coat the chicken in the breadcrumb mixture 
- Fry chicken in a pan with oil until golden brown 
- Place chicken in a baking dish, top with marinara sauce 
- Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top and bake for 20 minutes 
- Garnish with fresh basil and serve hot

- 1 whole chicken (about 1.5 kg) 
- 3 cups jasmine rice 
- 6 cloves garlic, minced 
- 1 thumb-sized piece of ginger, sliced 
- 4 stalks green onions, chopped 
- 4 cups chicken broth 
- 2 tablespoons sesame oil 
- Salt to taste 
- Soy sauce for serving 
- Chili sauce for serving

- Clean and prepare the chicken 
- Boil the chicken in water with ginger and salt for 45 minutes 
- Remove chicken, brush with sesame oil, and set aside 
- Sauté garlic and ginger in oil until fragrant 
- Add jasmine rice and stir to coat in oil 
- Pour in chicken broth, bring to a boil, and simmer until rice is cooked 
- Chop the boiled chicken into bite-sized pieces 
- Serve chicken over rice with soy sauce and chili sauce on the side 
- Garnish with chopped green onions 
- Enjoy your chicken rice with sliced cucumbers

1 kg fresh crab, cleaned and cracked 
- 4 tablespoons vegetable oil 
- 5 cloves garlic, minced 
- 3 red chilies, chopped 
- 1/4 cup tomato paste 
- 1/4 cup ketchup 
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce 
- 1 tablespoon sugar 
- 1/2 cup water 
- 1 egg, lightly beaten

- Clean and crack the crabs 
- Heat oil in a large wok over medium heat 
- Add garlic and chilies, sauté until fragrant 
- Stir in tomato paste, ketchup, soy sauce, and sugar 
- Add water and bring the sauce to a simmer 
- Add the crabs, stir to coat them in the sauce 
- Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes until crabs are cooked 
- Stir in the beaten egg slowly to thicken the sauce 
- Serve hot with steamed rice or fried buns 
- Garnish with fresh cilantro and enjoy

2 1/4 cups (270g) all-purpose flour 
- 1/4 cup (60g) sugar 
- 1 teaspoon salt 
- 1 tablespoon instant yeast 
- 1/2 cup (120ml) warm milk 
- 1 cup (225g) unsalted butter, chilled 
- 1 large egg 
- 1 tablespoon water 
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
- Extra flour for dusting

- Combine flour, sugar, salt, and yeast in a bowl 
- Add warm milk and mix to form a dough 
- Roll out dough and place chilled butter in the center 
- Fold dough over the butter and roll out again 
- Repeat folding and rolling process 3-4 times 
- Cut dough into triangles and roll into croissant shapes 
- Place croissants on a baking sheet and let rise for 1 hour 
- Brush with egg wash (egg mixed with water) before baking 
- Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20-25 minutes until golden brown 
- Enjoy warm croissants with butter or jam

- 500g chicken breast, sliced 
- 2 bell peppers, sliced 
- 1 large onion, sliced 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil 
- 1 tablespoon fajita seasoning 
- 1 teaspoon cumin powder 
- 1 teaspoon chili powder 
- 8 flour tortillas 
- Sour cream for serving 
- Salsa for serving

- Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat 
- Sauté chicken until browned, then add fajita seasoning, cumin, and chili powder 
- Add sliced bell peppers and onions, stir-fry until vegetables are tender 
- Warm the flour tortillas on a pan or in the oven 
- Spoon the chicken and vegetable mixture onto each tortilla 
- Top with sour cream and salsa 
- Fold the tortillas to make fajitas 
- Serve hot with guacamole or extra salsa 
- Enjoy your flavorful fajitas with lime wedges

- 500g cod or haddock fillets 
- 1 cup all-purpose flour 
- 1/2 cup cornstarch 
- 1 teaspoon baking powder 
- 1 cup cold beer or soda water 
- Salt to taste 
- Black pepper to taste 
- 4 large potatoes, cut into fries 
- Oil for frying 
- Lemon wedges for garnish

- Peel and cut potatoes into fries 
- Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot 
- Fry the potatoes until golden and crispy, then drain on paper towels 
- Season the fish fillets with salt and pepper 
- Mix flour, cornstarch, and baking powder in a bowl 
- Gradually add cold beer or soda water to make the batter 
- Dip the fish fillets in the batter and fry until golden brown 
- Serve hot with the fries and lemon wedges 
- Add tartar sauce or malt vinegar on the side

200g shrimp, peeled and deveined 
- 200g pork belly, boiled and sliced 
- 100g rice vermicelli noodles 
- 12 rice paper wrappers 
- Fresh lettuce leaves 
- Fresh mint leaves 
- Fresh coriander leaves 
- 1 cucumber, julienned 
- 1 carrot, julienned 
- Peanut sauce for dipping

- Boil the shrimp until cooked and set aside 
- Boil the pork belly and slice thinly 
- Cook the rice vermicelli noodles and drain 
- Dip each rice paper wrapper in warm water to soften 
- Place lettuce, mint, coriander, cucumber, and carrot on the wrapper 
- Add a few shrimp and pork slices on top of the vegetables 
- Roll the wrapper tightly, folding in the sides as you go 
- Repeat the process for all the rolls 
- Serve the spring rolls with peanut dipping sauce 
- Enjoy fresh and healthy Gỏi Cuốn

1 can (400g) chickpeas, drained and rinsed 
- 2 tablespoons tahini 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil 
- 1 clove garlic, minced 
- 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice 
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin 
- Salt to taste 
- Black pepper to taste 
- Paprika for garnish 
- Fresh parsley for garnish

- Combine chickpeas, tahini, olive oil, and garlic in a food processor 
- Add lemon juice and cumin, blend until smooth 
- If the hummus is too thick, add a bit of water to achieve desired consistency 
- Season with salt and pepper to taste 
- Transfer to a serving dish 
- Drizzle with extra olive oil on top 
- Sprinkle with paprika and garnish with parsley 
- Serve with pita bread or fresh vegetables 
- Enjoy your creamy homemade hummus

- 12 lasagna noodles 
- 500g ground beef 
- 1 onion, chopped 
- 3 cloves garlic, minced 
- 800g canned tomatoes, crushed 
- 500g ricotta cheese 
- 2 cups mozzarella cheese, shredded 
- 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese 
- Fresh basil leaves for garnish 
- Salt and pepper to taste

- Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) 
- Cook lasagna noodles according to package instructions 
- In a large pan, sauté ground beef, onion, and garlic until browned 
- Stir in crushed tomatoes, simmer for 15 minutes 
- In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese with salt and pepper 
- In a baking dish, layer noodles, meat sauce, ricotta, and mozzarella 
- Repeat layers, finishing with mozzarella and Parmesan on top 
- Bake for 30-40 minutes until cheese is bubbly and golden 
- Let the lasagna cool for 10 minutes before serving 
- Garnish with fresh basil and enjoy your delicious lasagna

- 1 cup rice 
- 1/2 cup urad dal (black gram) 
- 2 boiled potatoes, mashed 
- 1 onion, sliced 
- 2 green chilies, chopped 
- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds 
- Curry leaves for garnish 
- 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder 
- Oil for cooking 
- Salt to taste

- Soak rice and urad dal for 4-6 hours, then grind to a smooth batter 
- Ferment batter overnight 
- Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and onions 
- Add mashed potatoes, green chilies, and turmeric, mix well 
- Heat a tawa, pour batter to form thin crepes 
- Spread potato filling inside dosa 
- Fold the dosa and cook until crispy 
- Serve with coconut chutney and sambar 
- Enjoy your delicious South Indian masala dosa

- 300g pasta of choice 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil 
- 2 cloves garlic, minced 
- 400g canned tomatoes, crushed 
- 1 teaspoon dried basil 
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano 
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes 
- 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese 
- Fresh basil for garnish 
- Salt and pepper to taste

- Cook pasta according to package instructions 
- Heat olive oil in a pan, add garlic and sauté until fragrant 
- Add crushed tomatoes, dried basil, oregano, and red pepper flakes 
- Simmer sauce for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally 
- Season with salt and pepper to taste 
- Toss cooked pasta with the sauce 
- Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on top 
- Garnish with fresh basil 
- Serve hot and enjoy your flavorful pasta

- 1 pack puff pastry 
- 2 cups milk 
- 1 cinnamon stick 
- 1/2 cup sugar 
- 1 tablespoon flour 
- 4 egg yolks 
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
- Powdered sugar for garnish 
- Ground cinnamon for garnish 
- Butter for greasing

- Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F) 
- Roll out puff pastry and cut into small circles, place in greased muffin tins 
- In a saucepan, heat milk with cinnamon stick 
- Mix sugar and flour, then whisk in hot milk 
- Cook until thickened, then remove from heat and let cool slightly 
- Stir in egg yolks and vanilla 
- Pour custard into pastry shells 
- Bake for 15-20 minutes until golden brown 
- Sprinkle with powdered sugar and cinnamon before serving 
- Enjoy your delicious Portuguese Pastel de Nata

- 2 cups flour 
- 1/2 cup sour cream 
- 1 egg 
- 1/4 cup butter, melted 
- 4 boiled potatoes, mashed 
- 1 onion, chopped 
- 1/2 cup cottage cheese 
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 
- Salt to taste 
- Butter for frying

- In a bowl, mix flour, egg, sour cream, and melted butter to form a dough 
- Roll out dough and cut into circles 
- In a pan, sauté onions and mix with mashed potatoes, cottage cheese, salt, and pepper 
- Place filling in the center of dough circles, fold and seal edges 
- Boil pierogi in salted water until they float 
- Fry pierogi in butter until golden 
- Serve with sour cream or sautéed onions 
- Enjoy your traditional Polish pierogi

- 1 whole chicken, spatchcocked 
- 4 tablespoons piri piri sauce 
- 2 cloves garlic, minced 
- 1 lemon, juiced 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil 
- 1 teaspoon paprika 
- 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper 
- Salt and pepper to taste 
- Fresh parsley for garnish 
- Lemon wedges for serving

- Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F) 
- In a bowl, mix piri piri sauce, garlic, lemon juice, olive oil, paprika, and cayenne pepper 
- Rub the mixture all over the chicken 
- Let it marinate for at least 1 hour 
- Roast the chicken in the oven for 45-50 minutes, basting occasionally 
- Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before serving 
- Garnish with fresh parsley and lemon wedges 
- Serve with rice or fries and enjoy your spicy piri piri chicken

- 2 cups all-purpose flour 
- 1 teaspoon yeast 
- 1/2 teaspoon salt 
- 1 cup warm water 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil 
- 1/2 cup pizza sauce 
- 1 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded 
- Toppings of choice (pepperoni, mushrooms, bell peppers) 
- Fresh basil leaves 
- Olive oil for brushing

- Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F) 
- In a bowl, mix flour, yeast, salt, water, and olive oil to form dough 
- Let the dough rise for 1 hour 
- Roll out the dough on a floured surface 
- Spread pizza sauce over the dough 
- Add mozzarella cheese and desired toppings 
- Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes until the crust is golden 
- Brush with olive oil and garnish with fresh basil 
- Slice and enjoy your homemade pizza

- 200g fresh tuna or salmon, cubed 
- 1/4 cup soy sauce 
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil 
- 1 teaspoon rice vinegar 
- 1 tablespoon sesame seeds 
- 1/2 avocado, diced 
- 1/4 cup green onions, sliced 
- 1/2 cup cooked rice 
- Seaweed for garnish 
- Chili flakes for spice

- In a bowl, mix soy sauce, sesame oil, rice vinegar, and sesame seeds 
- Add cubed tuna or salmon to the sauce, marinate for 15 minutes 
- Prepare a bowl with cooked rice as the base 
- Arrange marinated fish, avocado, and green onions on top of the rice 
- Garnish with seaweed and chili flakes 
- Serve immediately and enjoy your fresh poke bowl 
- Customize with additional toppings like cucumber or radish

- 4 large potatoes, thinly sliced 
- 2 tablespoons olive oil 
- 1/2 teaspoon sea salt 
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper 
- 1/4 teaspoon paprika 
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder 
- 1/4 teaspoon onion powder 
- Fresh parsley for garnish 
- Dipping sauce of choice 
- Oil for frying

- Soak sliced potatoes in cold water for 30 minutes 
- Pat dry the potatoes with a towel 
- Heat oil in a pan for frying 
- Fry the potato slices until golden and crispy 
- Drain on paper towels and season with salt, pepper, and spices 
- Serve with your favorite dipping sauce 
- Enjoy your homemade crispy potato chips

- 500g beef, cubed 
- 2 cups coconut milk 
- 1 onion, chopped 
- 3 cloves garlic, minced 
- 2 tablespoons ground coriander 
- 1 tablespoon turmeric powder 
- 2 stalks lemongrass, bruised 
- 5 dried chilies, soaked and blended 
- 1 cinnamon stick 
- Salt to taste

- In a pot, heat oil and sauté onions, garlic, and chilies 
- Add beef, cook until browned 
- Stir in coriander, turmeric, and cinnamon stick 
- Add coconut milk and lemongrass, simmer for 2-3 hours 
- Stir occasionally, allowing the sauce to reduce and thicken 
- Season with salt to taste 
- Cook until the beef is tender and the sauce is rich 
- Serve with rice and enjoy your flavorful rendang

- 2 cups paella rice 
- 500g mixed seafood (shrimp, mussels, squid) 
- 4 cups fish stock 
- 1 onion, chopped 
- 2 cloves garlic, minced 
- 1/2 teaspoon saffron threads 
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika 
- 1 red bell pepper, chopped 
- Fresh parsley for garnish 
- Lemon wedges for serving

- Heat oil in a large pan, sauté onion, garlic, and bell pepper 
- Add rice and cook for 2 minutes, stirring to coat 
- Pour in fish stock, saffron, and smoked paprika, bring to a boil 
- Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes, without stirring 
- Add seafood on top of the rice, cover, and cook for 10 minutes 
- Remove from heat and let the paella rest for 5 minutes 
- Garnish with fresh parsley and serve with lemon wedges 
- Enjoy your delicious seafood paella

- 2 cups shredded green papaya 
- 1 carrot, shredded 
- 2 cloves garlic, minced 
- 1-2 Thai chilies, chopped 
- 2 tablespoons fish sauce 
- 1 tablespoon lime juice 
- 1 tablespoon palm sugar 
- 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved 
- 2 tablespoons roasted peanuts 
- Fresh cilantro for garnish

- In a mortar, pound garlic, chilies, and palm sugar together 
- Add fish sauce and lime juice, mix well 
- Combine shredded papaya, carrots, and cherry tomatoes in a bowl 
- Pour the dressing over the papaya mixture, toss to combine 
- Sprinkle roasted peanuts on top 
- Garnish with fresh cilantro 
- Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Som Tam 
- Pair with sticky rice or grilled meats

string-array.item: ~500–700 calories per serving (depends on portion size).
~150–200 calories per serving (28g or a small handful).
